intro: Dombeya shupangae var. shupangae, commonly known as the Shupangae Dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
